key_risks: Intense competition from major players like Shopify, WooCommerce, and Magento
High customer churn and retention challenges
Sensitivity to economic downturns and shifts in consumer behavior
Dependence on third-party partners like Google, Amazon, and AWS
Ongoing legal and regulatory risks, including litigation and data privacy compliance
controversies: Ongoing litigation related to intellectual property and contractual disputes
Potential reputational damage from legal battles
social_issues: Ensuring data privacy and security compliance in a global market
governance_issues: High debt-to-equity ratio of 7.48, indicating financial leverage concerns

sources.title: Ecommerce Compliance: Common Regulations + FAQs
sources.snippet: Ecommerce compliance refers to how online businesses meet the regulatory requirements of the markets they're selling in. This includes a broad collection of legal and ethical issues that impact most — or all — parts of the business. It's vitally important to a company's long-term success that it meets compliance standards at all times.
